channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Microsoft and TikTok's parent company ByteDance are exploring a deal for the service in the US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand.
item.title: Trump gives TikTok September deadline for sale of US operations

item.description: Donald Trump's efforts to block a subpoena for his tax returns could provide him with immunity from prosecution, says the Manhattan District Attorney's Office.
item.title: Trump is blocking tax returns subpoena to secure immunity: court filings

item.description: Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic will work with engine maker Rolls-Royce to develop a plane that can travel at three times the speed of sound.
item.title: Rolls-Royce joins Virgin Galactic's Mach 3 plane project

item.description: Norway will ban all cruise ships with more than 100 people from its ports, as Spain announces its COVID-19 app is twice as effective as human tracers.
item.title: Norway bans passengers from large cruise ships, Spain hails COVID app

item.description: John Hume won the Nobel Peace Prize for his role in ending 30 years of sectarian violence in Northern Ireland.
item.title: John Hume, Nobel laureate and Good Friday Agreement architect, dies

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 4, 2020

item.description: Making the wearing of masks compulsory when outside is a simple but effective precautionary public health measure. So what is the Premier waiting for?
item.title: Make masks mandatory or we may mimic Melbourne

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: The shutdown of Victorian businesses will sap consumer and business confidence across the nation.
item.title: Victoria's lockdown will be $1b 'whack' to NSW economy

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Less than two years after Ivan Cleary walked out on the club, Tigers officials called a meeting to ensure history wasn't repeating.
item.title: 'He's given us his word': Tigers probe Maguire over Cowboys rumours

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The government has released artist's impressions of parkland to be built above an underground interchange for WestConnex.
item.title: Sydney's newest inner city park to feature much-needed sporting fields

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Three corporate giants have combined to develop the country's biggest PET plastic recycling plant in a $45 million deal in a boost to the waste industry.
item.title: Recycling plant set to boost waste industry after China blow

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: NSW Treasurer Dominic Perrottet needs to step up and take decisive action to arrest this disaster.
item.title: Jaw-dropping revelations show icare must be overhauled

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: The MasterChef winner is taking culinary diplomacy to new heights.
item.title: Australia's diplomatic effort has an unlikely new agent in Adam Liaw

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW's biggest enemy in the COVID-19 battle is complacency, but shackling the economy is the government's last resort.
item.title: 'Stubborn' case numbers will drive NSW's response to COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Offices, parks, studios, markets, recording studios, a soccer field and an Olympic swimming pool are all ideas for the Woolloongabba Cross River Rail site.
item.title: The Greens' alternative vision for a new Gabba public space

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Money managers say tighter restrictions are the only option to get Victoria's case numbers under control but warn of worsening economic conditions for the state.
item.title: 'Short-term pain, long-term gain': fund managers support stage 4 lockdown

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Ride-share services in Melbourne will be restricted under stage four lockdowns prompting Uber and Didi to sharpen their focus on delivery offerings.
item.title: Ridesharing limited in Melbourne as Uber and Didi turn to delivery

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Health authorities say this week will be critical to clamping down a Queensland virus cluster, with some way to go before it is declared contained.
item.title: Experts watch to see if Queensland virus cluster has sting in tail

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The Coalition's former aged care spokeswoman has slammed the government's handling of aged care and called for major structural change.
item.title: Government chose 'futile bureaucratic exercise' over aged care reform, Liberal MP says

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australia's future submarines are needed more than ever because of the coronavirus, Opposition defence spokesman Richard Marles will warn.
item.title: 'Profoundly compromised': Labor ramps up attacks on delayed submarines

item.description: That perfect time you’re waiting for to become a father? Yeah, well… that day is never going to arrive.
item.title: So, you're going to be a dad ... in a pandemic

item.description: Erratic, self-centred, irresponsible, sullen, hysterical, rebellious, exhibitionistic, fad-driven. Remind you of anyone?
item.title: The Teenager, as known to modern history

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Unisuper has dropped its holdings in three ASX-listed energy companies but would not comment on whether this was a broader thermal exclusion across the fund.
item.title: Unisuper dumps coal assets as sector turns its back on fossil fuels

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: If Democrat Joe Biden is elected to the White House, relations with China will change significantly – and Australia will be a key part of the shift.
item.title: 'Competition without catastrophe': US policy with China if Biden wins

item.dc:creator: Brian Toohey
item.description: Home Affairs Minister Peter Dutton is pushing a bill that would give Australia the right to force overseas companies to disclose data about Australian citizens. It would also give reciprocal rights to a number of foreign governments.
item.title: Security concerns over reciprocal data exchange deal

item.description: The #EndCOVIDForAll campaign aims to help poorer nations deal with the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Millions of children may never return to school after lockdown

item.description: More than 400 drowned when the Cataraqui was wrecked off the north-western coast of Tasmania. It was one of Australia's worst ever maritime disasters.
item.title: From the Archives, 1845: The wreck of the Cataraqui

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: The "usual oaths", Maitland on the rise and the Daily Ordinary no more.
item.title: In the Herald: August 4, 1846

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, August 4

item.dc:creator: Jon Faine
item.description: That the case numbers have plateaued is no solace to those losing their jobs and wondering how they will pay rent or a mortgage when support ends.
item.title: We should have gone to stage four a week ago

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Craig Kelly had touted the anti-malarial drug as a coronavirus wonder drug despite a lack of scientific evidence backing that conclusion.
item.title: Liberal MP defends colleagues taking on medical experts

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: 'We can make it through anything': VCE students steel themselves for another bout of learning from home.
item.title: 'It's a little unsettling': VCE students return to learning from home

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Many small business owners say they were already struggling to keep afloat ahead of Wednesday night's forced shutdown.
item.title: 'It'll be tough, very tough': Small businesses steel themselves for retail shutdown

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Childcare providers are braced for plummeting attendance rates in the next six weeks that could send some centres to the wall as most families keep their children home.
item.title: Childcare centres in dark on who will attend during stricter lockdown

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: A wellness business owned by controversial biochemist Shane Charter has been fined $63,000 for "unlawfully advertising" a preventative treatment for coronavirus.
item.title: Dr Ageless fined over fake 'breakthrough' COVID-19 treatment

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Western Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge pointed to the need for Victorians to have something to feel good about.
item.title: 'Critical' to keep positive, Bulldogs coach Beveridge says

item.description: Has talk about stage three "not working" actually undermined our confidence in the restrictions and lessened our resolve to abide by the rules?
item.title: Latest restrictions became a self-fulfilling prophecy

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Chief executive John Nagle has quit the board of icare after a difficult day at a parliamentary inquiry.
item.title: Icare boss quits after failing to adequately declare wife's involvement

item.description: The status quo has been blown to smithereens and we are necessarily inventing a new way of interacting.
item.title: The world has opened up digitally like never before

item.description: Hundreds of prisoners remain at large after the terrorist group's attack on the jail in Jalalabad.
item.title: More than 20 killed after Islamic State storm Afghan jail

item.description: Benedict, aged 93, has become very frail and his voice is barely audible, his biographer told a German newspaper.
item.title: 'An old man of 93': Vatican denies Benedict XVI is seriously ill

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Dylan Ruiz-Diaz came off the bench to score twice in the last five minutes to snatch a memorable win for Central Coast and add to Melbourne Victory's misery.
item.title: Ruiz-Diaz flips script for Mariners to deny Victory

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The Dogs dominated much of the first half against the ladder-leading Port Adelaide but were empty-handed when they got to the checkout, allowing the Power to swoop in and snag the remaining packet of biscuits.
item.title: Dogs blow chances against Port to leave top-eight place in peril

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The trainer and jockey breached racing’s strict coronavirus guidelines while posing for the photo on Saturday.
item.title: Baker, Schofield fined and tested after embracing for victory photo

item.description: The woman suffered multiple stab wounds and later died at Westmead Hospital.
item.title: Man arrested after woman, 32, fatally stabbed in unit in Oatlands

item.description: While some in the stocks lower the tone.
item.title: A helicopter pilot chops to the chase

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Mitch Cleary has been reinstated by the AFL, with the league claiming the journalist "acknowledged his mistake" for reporting the identity of Brooke Cotchin at the centre of Richmond's COVID-19 breach.
item.title: AFL journalist reinstated after being stood down

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: Lockdown 2.0 has taken a new turn in Melbourne, with a curfew and locals told to stay within five kilometres of their homes. What does it mean for you?
item.title: Victoria is in a state of disaster. What does that mean and what are the rules now?

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: A further 250,000 workers will be stood down or sent home under the new tougher curbs.
item.title: Jobs devastation as state's economy goes into deep freeze

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Melbourne entered a stage four lockdown overnight, after Victoria recorded 671 new cases. The city will be under a curfew and residents restricted to travel within 5km of their homes.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Victoria records 429 new COVID-19 cases as Daniel Andrews implements business restrictions amid Melbourne stage four lockdown; Australian death toll jumps to 221
